intro: Hubertia faujasioides, commonly known as the desert hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of Africa. It is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. The plant thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, making it well-suited for xeriscaping. Its stems are often woody and can branch out to form a shrub-like structure. Hubertia faujasioides is known for its drought tolerance and ability to bloom throughout the growing season.
